Detailed Description

A special version of CollectorManager, used to get the session and template information from a transmitter.

Unlike its superclass, this class is designed to run one thread, outputting its progress (via a log callback), and it can be cancelled at any time.

Also unlike its superclass (CollectorManager), this does not run until stopped; it runs until it gets a response from the transmitter (or times out in getting a response). So, if you let it run to completion, there is no need to call waitForConnectionsToFinish, although that shouldn't hurt.

  // in one thread
  CollectorSetupManager manager = new CollectorSetupManager(...);
  Thread managerThread = new Thread(manager, "Setup from ...");
  managerThread.start();
  managerThread.join();
  if (manager.finishedWithoutError()) {
      String vendorString = manager.getVendorString();
      ...
  } else {
      throw manager.getRunException();
  }

If you have another thread running, it can cancel the action by manager.stopAndWaitForConnectionsToFinish(), which should cause the an exception in the thread (that is, manager.finishedWithoutError() should return false).

XXX Need to test that this actually does stop things.

See also:
ConnectionSetupThread
Version:
Id
CollectorSetupManager.java,v 1.5 2005/04/08 12:48:10 guyg Exp

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

com::xacct::CRANE::collector::CollectorSetupManager::CollectorSetupManager (  ExtendedInetAddress  collectorAddress,
int  collectorConnectPortId,
LogHandler  log,
ExtendedInetAddress  transmitterAddress,
int  transmitterPort,
int  transmitterVersionPort,
int  connectTimeout,
int  reconnectInterval
)  throws ConfigException [inline]
 

Get the session/template information from an transmitter. This creates a connection, starts a thread, sends a "get sessions" request. You can monitor its progress with the log callback. You do not need to do stopAndWaitForConnectionsToFinish().

XXX This code is not fully baked: in particular, it does horrible things if there is already an existing connection. What it should do is something different if there's alread a connection.

Parameters:
collectorAddress This collector's address (may be null or "", in which case defaults to localhost).
collectorConnectPortId The connection port Id for identifying this collector to the transmitter.
log Gets progress messages.
transmitterAddress The remote transmitter's address.
transmitterPort Where to get data from at the transmitter if a connectino to the version port fails.
transmitterVersionPort The version negotiation port on the transmitter.
connectTimeout How long to wait for a UDP respone during version negotiation.
reconnectInterval How long to wait before trying to reconnect.
Exceptions:
ConfigException If there's something wrong with the configuration (shouldn't happen).
UnknownHostException If a local or remote address is invalid.

Check whether the thread produced any errors. Only meaningful if super.waitForConnectionsToFinish has finished (which should be the case if the constructor has done its job).

void com::xacct::CRANE::collector::CollectorSetupManager::run (   )  [inline]
 

Do the actual processing. 

00152                       {
00153         try {
00154             initAndStartConnections(collectorSetupConfig, log, null);
00155         } catch(InterruptedException e) {
00156             // This situation shouldn't normally happen: it's only
00157             // there because there's a "sleep" between starting
00158             // threads and a sleep can be interrupted. So, this
00159             // situation shouldn't happen.
00160             throw new LogicException(this, "run",
00161                                      "Interrupted initAndStartConnections: " + e);
00162         }
00163         waitForConnectionsToFinish();
00164     }
